definition: conceal, protect, or shelter (someone or something) with a screen or something forming a screen
examples: her hair swung across to screen her face
a high hedge screened all of the front from passers-by

definition: show (a film or video) or broadcast (a television programme)
examples: the show is to be screened by the BBC later this year

definition: test (a person or substance) for the presence or absence of a disease
examples: outpatients were screened for cervical cancer

definition: pass (a substance such as grain or coal) through a large sieve or screen, especially so as to sort it into different sizes
examples: granulated asphalt—manufactured to 40 mm down or screened to 28 mm & 14 mm down
